titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Victor P. Saladini papers, 1952-1989
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2002 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Roman Catholic priest who was both a scholar of farm labor problems in California and an active participant with the Mexican American labor movement, particularly the United Farm Workers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Victor P. Saladini papers. M0686. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, research files, talks, papers, publications, parish work, community work, articles and information on Cesar Chavez (and correspondence with), book reviews, farm labor contracts, and research on the Reclamation Law of 1902. Related materials: Victor P. Salandini papers, 1949-1992 (M249)

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Agricultural laborers--California.
Labor disputes--California.
Mexican Americans--Civil rights.
